posts.body:
I think that all the posts texts are stored in the database and muting does not remove the posts texts from the database.
I think the SPAM problem have to be treated using identity authority like zeroid.bit, new user need to solve some antibot measures and such, maybe ID provider can be run by the chan owner so he can attempt to pair spammers to IPs they used to register identities and ban IPs, IP subnets based on that. Also there is an inactive ID authority that require e-mail verification before identity is active. More about that in [this post](/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/1F4Ed2JCo7ffcFFFREMtKFrtSonFL381bp:infinity:5d7f90b7-044a-4338-b343-95756b075bad#ffd4b388-48c3-43e3-b72e-6be21de14b15).
Issues related to antibot system:
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1310
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1608

>>b0cfa239-461f-481e-87b9-1ed5fd58eaed
Please @08admin revert this or add the guide on how to switch user identity to the site header for like one week so users know how to proceed.

How users can fix the issue with posting new content:
Go to http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/ and get an identity, go to 08chan, drag&drop corner button to the left and scrolling down find identity field where selecting zeroid

How users/admin may fix the issue with old users content not appearing (many content.json files not updated):
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1565330250_18h7dSc5vXQNRA1sjyUmX7zaUTsFARHa5U#comment_891_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS

>>018c9356-c4e7-4950-8e16-0a360f2a324b
> quiet
maybe because of the [content publish failed](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:b0cfa239-461f-481e-87b9-1ed5fd58eaed) issue

Got "Content publish failed" problem. Solution was posted [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:b0cfa239-461f-481e-87b9-1ed5fd58eaed)

>>eb118425-2981-43d9-b25c-7b7d1c0255ee
this should be added to the site header or admin revert back to self-generated certs to [prevent "Content publish failed"](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:b0cfa239-461f-481e-87b9-1ed5fd58eaed)

>>fc1211c6-9e43-48cb-b3bf-f85b7edc978c
yes, CPU may be highly utilized when there are multiple large pages with "loading" images. When restarting browser, it may be fixed for a while. Maybe admin can add an option to limit number of posts per page..

>>2cd57e3f-5c77-4a99-806e-7e3940eef813
old members possibly unable to post and do not know how to fix, though fix is here:

Go to http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroid.bit and get an identity
Go back to 08chan, drag&drop corner button to the left and scrolling down find identity field where selecting zeroid

>>ba8ab901-67ae-436c-bbe8-c001e131a9a7
> normal Brave but I cannot open this site with the tor browser
someone said that one have to go to the tor browser settings, proxy tab, and set 127.0.0.1:43110 (or such) as the address that should be ignored.

>>d908e4fe-c030-441b-bc60-55254c5302bd
currently as this zite owner allowed only zeroid.bit, we can use blocklists feature and created blocklists of spammers we can share:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1530020784_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K
having 3K peers, 52/162 trackers, tor available, port closed (on [zerohello](/))

>>0fd89263-e396-4023-b010-cdc32ddfc66c
>running like shit today
For me the discussion threads are running ok, takes a few seconds to load, but that seems normal. Note that i am not a heavy seeder on this site, not many optional files was downloaded by me. I am also using [updated code](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1#d908e4fe-c030-441b-bc60-55254c5302bd).

>>d3300b69-5c6b-4a00-a85d-26bcc63df6df
good peer count. i am having 3000. Interesting is that on ZeroHello i see something like 800.
You have alot of fileparts queued for the download as per the screenshot. i would check if your storage medium is not the bottleneck of your slow zeronet. (i mean regarding not just IO, but mainly IOPS).
Also check if zeronet is not using 100% of the CPU thread, it can be the cause of the slowness too. Another cause is the zeronet problem where it is lagging when you have many files queued and actively downloaded as you have per the screenshot.

>>24173e29-d595-4682-8b6e-810fc5f5ef12
per my experience this is normal. Can not have 15/15, that never happen to me.

>>f390e5cd-3479-413d-9cb8-85ad0c545e57
working ;) when content is published to peers, it means all good )

>>ea5eeb5b-6345-4a9c-a54b-02a0e4fa087f
i am unsure about which update you are talking about, but i updated like 48 hours back to millchan code http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1#6ab9c4db-26f4-408f-86ba-548c5aa01625 and the chan is working for me so far

>>59384587-adf5-4c6a-a260-a8ea5d942d06
> not obvious
yes, someone should make a pul request for this (first asking HelloZeroNet user who is the maintainer of the ZN) and make it more intuitive: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/

>>8bd5aa18-6133-48d8-9c4c-bd625618ca93
>Is there any way to tell what user I have muted
yes, you can check zeronet/data/filters.json file on your computer, it includes usernames, sites where it was blocked and their public keys (IDs)
Also you can do it via Zerohello, three dots menu next to a logo and her emanage Muted users.. (and also un-mute).

>>0f765d74-af13-4aef-a020-44f258dcbb26
>>789cd8ba-ec99-4588-a2c0-b038926d460d
being you i would wait for zeronet to fully download the site, then trying to post or edit the things

>>cfa75b48-d0b9-4a9a-9e08-ed8f0235867a
if zeronet told you that your content was published to peers, then you are ok :)

>>f48c6ca8-a17b-4ae2-aa0e-c7db21cb998b
i have not touched cert_signers. Where it is described that one should do anything with that?

>>0f765d74-af13-4aef-a020-44f258dcbb26
>sometimes people reply to nonexistent posts, and there is no way for me to see who that mysterious user is
i would assume the reasons for the non existent posts is either that user was muted or your zeronet database is not fully downloaded (may be wrong). If it is because of muting, you can not do anything to view the hidden content except unmuting all users. Unsure if Millchan ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/ ) is made to schow you the content of the muted post when you hover over the >>XXX link, but it may be interesting feature, though unsure if it is doable regarding programming. People add feature requests to millchan /dev/ board or on Gitgud.com millchan repo.

>>24ebd238-34bd-4135-a1af-49dea18d8d9d
it would be interesting to see a screenshot of what you can see in the site menu (one under the corner top button on this page, when you drag it to the left and scroll down where is seen the database size, optional files, and files that needs update. I think site itself (mandatory files and the .db) should DL in mater of minutes and that means you should be able to post and see texts and all topics that are not muted. Optional files (images) is another story and it can slow down zeronet i think if the downoad of many files is active (seen on zerohello sites list).

>>0b9ef437-6b69-45d7-9ca1-a3709b9f2e58
yes, i think all we need to do is to switch identity from this self-signed one to zeroid.bit. The way to do it is described in the first comment here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:b0cfa239-461f-481e-87b9-1ed5fd58eaed (my post)

>>71a424ac-6cb6-4c62-b3f0-e47015e21d0a
>How you keep the blacklist/mute list when you change certs/IDs?
it is strange in my zeronet (it is py3 version for the Windows - http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1559840057_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS#comment_857_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS
i have zeronet/dat/filters.json (in earlier versions was file mutes.json) and that file contains my millchan site mutes and it does not seem these are tied to my identity as you suggest. So i would not expect these mutes would not be used if i change identity on 08chan or on millchan.. unless i delete the mutes.json or filters.json file mentioned.

>>af1975ef-601a-4c99-9ce0-16dd77582405
and you tried to quit ZN, rename your zeronet/data folder, start ZN (to generate whole empty new identity and session), open the 08chan and let it sync maybe a hour, do not post anything?
If it still stuck i would assume some misconfiguration site owner did. You can then in this blank state go to http://127.0.0.1:43110/Config/ and ont he bottom enable logging of everything, restart ZN and see what ZN is showing (in zeronet/log/debug.log) while it is atttempting to download site data. Maybe this log checking is useless, maybe save time. You can also use Millchan site http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/ which seems OK. And you can also try updating here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1

>>9fa9ae0d-ed12-4750-9bae-808a4d9d26c1
on the first screen database is incomplete. on the third it seems complete. My DB size is smaller 14268 kilobytes :-D. content.json files, i guess nothing than waiting, or the "Check files" menu option of the three dots menu that is next to the site name on the ZeroHello site list. Then waiting. I would enable logging of everything and see what zeronet says being seemingly "idle".. log is in zeronet/log/debug.log file.

>>9a2485f6-17a6-4848-84a2-135942c9fb72
unsure which old thread and which fix it needs. failed files - if you mean unseeded optional files (images..), then maybe no one have them, seeder is off the computer or such.
Did you tried tips i mentioned above? http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:v:494e061f-6677-477a-9d49-55bffc20a07b#post-4d478e21-5ac2-43d0-acb2-925d8ce12d10
In the meantime, you can also use Millchan (linked above).

>>8574a590-d47e-4a47-90c1-3e998612191d
it seems like if the blacklisted boards are saved in some file in your user profile... zeronet/data/siteaddress/data/users/youruseraddress/ ..

>>1404409e-3713-4773-9c1b-ddaa8947c5f4
i think that nothing serious. Because if you will be able to publish posts (it will say: published to XY peers) you are OK, you are in official database of the site (even your site files are not official/outdated). It was mentioned that one hav eto mark the site as own (inside the site menu) to prevent files be updated, but other person said better to amrk the files read-only. I have not bothered yet with marking read-only as the site do not show me any problem.

>>99c2115c-01f7-4dd8-85b4-d0b2e2c7d88a
>Invalid cert signer
i searched this error (invalid cert signer) on zerohello (search in connected sites field) and found one topic on zerotalk:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1529607521_153dW34Ng5fVUZ5D5NcZRfAbvRQS1jYC1k
Something is using 08chan self-signed certificate maybe, i would try switching to zeroid in 08cha site menu (corner button dragging to the left). And restarting zeronet, then on ZeroHello next to the 08chan site is three dots menu where is "Check files" option. It may not help, i do not know. PS: if one does not understand ZN workings, better to use offical files, do not mark any files read-only, do not modify files in site directories. (not sure if this is your case)
hi

>>6be45448-2b84-4c66-9c71-455e1397d753
>If I try to open it on the new device, I get an empty page.
even no board title or a reply button? On my main computer, i can see the page and i can post into it (using zeroid iidentity). On my other device, i had to wait like 15 seconds, but it appeared also. On my main computer i am having updated 08chan to millchan code ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1 ) and on other device i have stock 08chan that i DLed like 2 days ago and never deleted

>>d96ddf37-b463-4f1e-9384-945a52d7bcd0
>Cops can get your ID from a dynamic IP if they know when it was collected.
How exactly? Which ID you are talking about?

>>d96ddf37-b463-4f1e-9384-945a52d7bcd0
in zeronet zeronet identities, posts can not be linked to IPs/onion addresses. Cop can not know if the IP is a initial seeder (author of a post) or just any peer. But if you are not using good VPN or Tor, cop can discover that your IP is sharing possibly ilegal images (they do not know if you are its uploader or just a regular peer).

>>d96ddf37-b463-4f1e-9384-945a52d7bcd0
>How does my client know when it has a message yours doesn't? File hashes?
yes, check https://www.reddit.com/r/zeronet/comments/33uk59/presentation_about_how_does_zeronet_works/ ; that thread was started by zeronet creator

> How does ZeroID allow them to link posts with IPs
it does not allow it, identity provider does not influence the way how zeronet interconnect peers.

>>4d3b5d3a-ed26-4418-9a5f-c2ec80ef36c0
>At the moment it is 1gb downloaded vs 26gb uploaded
thx for uploading. be careful what you're seeding, i would not seed 08chan images without using good VPN.

>>ad0b2a72-16ba-4536-851d-cff1c10516f2
>Delete 08chan and try again, it probably won't work
i should try, tomorrow, but i should backup the working site before i do it

>>5a91d8f0-c93e-45c9-af4d-2e4a81f29c99
yes. lets hope admin will fix it, or people move to Millchan or someone clone Millchan.
1.2k to 2.6k seems ok, maybe it takes zeronet a while and there was thousands of the users, so people have to download thousands of content.json files i assume. So it seems better not to delete the site ;) But based on what >>f813708a-34f0-478f-b4e1-199042c61381 says, it can be problem that just downloading will not solve.

>>d042fc72-be2b-45d0-91aa-5f2133d7ff41
i do not know that maybe it is in the docs (i linked a few posts above (reddit link)), or here:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/help_zeronet/network_protocol/
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Kt7xxVRcxHcK14Mt7YZdXfh8MzUJMkvpk/misc/The.truth.about.ZeroNet/

>POW ID's
here is what ZN creatr thinks about PoW: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/404#issuecomment-204694398

posts.subject: Good setup for anonymous & secure internet usage?
posts.body:
OP, thanks for the tips and interesting reading!

@ALL i was thinking it may be handy to link to a tutorial i writen myself, its name is:

"What is the good setup for anonymous & secure internet usage?"

URL:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1517258702_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/What+is+the+good+setup+for+anonymous+secure+internet+usage

NEEDS TO BE UDATED
content.json
...
...
+1208 more
(it is in the site's menu - corner button when dragged to the left)

Anyone see the same? [Here is similar user, showing screenshots](/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:v:494e061f-6677-477a-9d49-55bffc20a07b#post-9fa9ae0d-ed12-4750-9bae-808a4d9d26c1). What is the reason and consequences of this?

>>8d1b94db-b183-442f-ad48-933c4b1e180f
>way to turn off images from displaying automatically
i think that maybe you can edit the appropriate file of the site code and then mark this site as yours (from within site menu) and make that file read-only so the ZN will not overwrite it by authorized version of the file.

>>fda34768-132e-42c1-8992-b77c35db6d0a
Check the thread "Seedbox hardware". There are related comments: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/1P9255S3hwQbP6aEBoCBYcyMHA8RVUZgv6:tech:e949b21e-af30-40f9-ac09-f9d961f62c66#post-a5bc8919-e911-4c62-9daa-e3c8932d33ae

>>cb695d22-1ccd-4ee1-832a-d889b954ff50
> bump
i bet people faced the issue with content publishing thanks to changes admin did on the site. Details: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:b0cfa239-461f-481e-87b9-1ed5fd58eaed

>>0cf3a5b1-81d2-4fd7-8dfe-b31bfec57a15
>How can I confirm i'm behind tor?
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Stats also shows current Zeronet connections, or if you enable logging of everything on the bottom of the http://127.0.0.1:43110/Config , then you can watch zeronet/log/debug.log file for the connection details.

>>d6b84f0f-c9ca-4ef7-a5db-a35efa412abd
>this is why you open localhost 127.0.1 in your proxy configuration on tor browser. That excludes yourself from tor.
indeed, though if one has Tor enabled or enforced inside Zeronet (button on the top of the ZeroHello page), then one is using Tor anyway (even if Tor browser is instructed to ignore the zeronets localhost address) - that's how i understand it. ZeroNet has bundled tor in its folders (maybe not always), one see the status on ZeroHello and there are hints on what to do in case it shows tor: error.

UPDATE: admin modified his [data/users/content.json](http://127.0.0.1:43110/17iF64gTLycSohUSJsFyq7FMYsQfMqghJa/?1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS_2) (may need to reload page a few times) and now things working. Some details here: 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:b0cfa239-461f-481e-87b9-1ed5fd58eaed#post-ab975c89-3e44-4fca-a89a-495a6f26528e

anyway, REST OF THIS POST IS HISTORY

>>1964beca-10ea-4cc2-8f34-45adcf73ba56
no, not fixed for me, please kindly check below. I have an idea that may/may not work:
>>ad0b2a72-16ba-4536-851d-cff1c10516f2
>Delete 08chan and try again, it probably won't work.
yes, i just did that and the databse is incomplete, like 60KB and like 2700 content.json files of users are there to be updated (when i am checking the site menu), but not updating. debug.log (in Everything logging mode) shows an error that in my user folder is not blacklist.json file and indeed there is not even my user directory.
When i checked content.json files in various users directories, all these had @zeroid.bit identity mentioned there, none of the user's content.json filels would be without zeroid id, so the site possibly do not want to download old identities of users who never switched to zeroid. Simply as >>f813708a-34f0-478f-b4e1-199042c61381 says:
> "Previously you used self-signed certs, so you pretty much allowed everything on the board ... Now that you only allow zeroid, you require each message and file and everything to be signed by a cert that is signed by zeroid. Since before nothing was signed with zeroid, everything will be invalid."
=> Way out? my idea for the @08admin - What about admin allowing all existing self-signed certs specificaly (probably in data/users/content.json file) and then disallow all remaining self-signed certs. So old ones will work, but new users will have to use zeroid.bit ? I think i have seen an example on zeroTalk where this is done. .*@08chan identity is set as forbidden, but specific (already existing usernamehere@08chan ids will be allowed? http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/site_development/content_json/#user_contents

Here is the list of all identities (folder names of the 08chan data/users/ folder) i have found - 2173: http://127.0.0.1:43110/17iF64gTLycSohUSJsFyq7FMYsQfMqghJa/?1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS_0
!! first you have to visit http://127.0.0.1:43110/17iF64gTLycSohUSJsFyq7FMYsQfMqghJa in order above link to load!

Here is my idea on how data/users/content.json may look like, note the last line in the "permissions" section:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/17iF64gTLycSohUSJsFyq7FMYsQfMqghJa/?1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS_1
(first visit http://127.0.0.1:43110/17iF64gTLycSohUSJsFyq7FMYsQfMqghJa in order to load my link)

It may not work, it is just an idea (UPDATE: seems to be working to load self-signed people content, hopefuly will block new self-signed people and bots).
If abve would not be sufficing, another idea would be not bothering with whitelisting identities in the file, but just setting a zero qouta (0 bytes) for 08chan identities, but unsure if it would not reject downloading because users files will be over quota.

- - -
[Here is](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1565330250_18h7dSc5vXQNRA1sjyUmX7zaUTsFARHa5U#comment_891_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS) zerotalk post on how one can use above linked content.json file to apply the WORKAROUND. But maybe admin will fix it and trying to apply this would be more trouble than benefit.

>>062f222d-c21c-4c98-aad5-f6002058efbf
i think it is like that, because all content.json files inside users directories the zeronet downloaded contained zeroid.bit identity. Seems like it can not DL non signed ones (those that does not contain zeroid.bit identity) as per the admin's authorized version of the data/users/content.json which lists only zeroid.bit identity as allowed. [Here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:v:494e061f-6677-477a-9d49-55bffc20a07b#post-c8dbed68-5c2a-4c40-a49d-bd5ac34edf4b) i posted my observation and an idea admin may try.

>>c404b1c3-59ba-44b2-86a5-5cdf6ad92e5d
@08admin, please kindly check my comment here:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:v:494e061f-6677-477a-9d49-55bffc20a07b#post-c8dbed68-5c2a-4c40-a49d-bd5ac34edf4b

>>fc44d546-2299-48d8-826e-8158945e70ca
i do not think the date is important atm, for example in [this site, user blocklist](http://127.0.0.1:43110/13CgSQeywg2ius5pjXVCk7dKUCRkz5xvW3/) i am using always the same date. never had a problem with that

>>41fae65e-1972-456c-b5f6-d64e45560986

I think users does not need to post here for a verification, because if zeronet say to them "Content published to ../5 peers" it means they are online and people see their content. If publishing fails, there is problem with the identity that have to be switched as described in the first post.

>>3632c3ad-1528-4868-bdbb-f38955cb8d24
you should be anonymouse when you use Tor (see the button on the top of the [Zerohello](/) ), and register the zeroid or 08chan ID thru Tor.

thanks for the guide. btw if someone has problems with posting, fastest way to fix that maybe this:
Go to http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/ and let it generate new identity for you if not did already, go to 08chan, drag&drop corner button to the left and scrolling down find identity field where selecting your zeroid identity

>>05ec9629-2a0b-4e87-bfce-c397d0a391c2
yes, but it is a bit complicated, check [this comment](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1565330250_18h7dSc5vXQNRA1sjyUmX7zaUTsFARHa5U#comment_891_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS) pls

>>d00f6c4a-b5ae-44ff-8d93-e9baefb1875f
>even though somebody else came up with a possible solution that he would just have to copy-paste

the idea was described [here](/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:v:494e061f-6677-477a-9d49-55bffc20a07b#post-c8dbed68-5c2a-4c40-a49d-bd5ac34edf4b), but more user readable guide for a user is [here](/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1565330250_18h7dSc5vXQNRA1sjyUmX7zaUTsFARHa5U#comment_891_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS) on ZT.

>>803e6759-b0a1-4db2-a5ff-930272ce7bc5
> 1.) Completely Remove ZeroNet
causes:
- loosing ability to ever modify anything you have posted at zeronet (including your sites)
- unable to further use your identities. the file that contains identities is zeronet/data/users.json (you may want to backup it).
- lossing followed topics on sites like millchan, zerotalk, zerome, zeroblog and its clones
- if you have shared some images and such and no one else have them yet, you will cause 0 seeders (dead) images on the site

Anyway i think that deleting ZN is not necessary.

PS: here is the guide on anonymous internet usage:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1517258702_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS/What+is+the+good+setup+for+anonymous+secure+internet+usage

>>ab975c89-3e44-4fca-a89a-495a6f26528e
ðŸ‘ What were the files that was updated? i am thinking if i can leave site marked as mine and manualy replace the file (so i do not need to re-apply whole [millchan update](/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1)).

UPDATE: YES it works for me. i have not needed to disable "This is my site" option, it updated the data/users/content.json file automaticaly. I went to ZeroHello site, found the 08chan, clicked the three dots next to the item (mouse hover over item) and selected "Check files". One may need to confirm to increase site size a few times. Or do not wait for ZeroHello prompts and increase it via 08chan site menu (corner button moving to the left at 08chan site).

I TESTED to post under zeroid and my old 08chan ID, both worked. But when i posted under new 08chan ID, then it prevented me posting (which is correct - admin allows only zeroid.bit identities). So all works. It seem not broken my Millchan update! :-)

>>7e302d8a-2927-425d-86ec-b9c2d18ee7cb
>if you tick "download and help distribute all files" and set the limit to 1MB, the final size should be about 6GB currently
good tip. this is good if one want to help seeding maximum number of files and save space not seeding large videos or such. it will DL most of the images

>>0c8b5c54-adf9-4bfa-b4e0-ea9343f76a82
> Can I add files/threads to seed on a seedbox?
atm there is no such option to seed all optional files in a discussion thread

>>96ecda81-a98c-4fb8-ba10-2d16c180b3e5
If someone has problem with slow download, i have these ideas: your network capacity not utilized by other apps, your cpu/hdd not over-utilized? your tracker count on the top of the [ZeroHello](/) site is not less than 4? Did you applied [advices](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:b0cfa239-461f-481e-87b9-1ed5fd58eaed#post-ab975c89-3e44-4fca-a89a-495a6f26528e) by admin?

>>721e022e-91a0-407d-a898-fcabf49ff027
>Should I portforward ports for TOR

On the top of the ZeroHello site is a Tor button where you can enable Tor for all peer connections. i think port status matter only for non-Tor peer connectivity, so no need to open anything in case of "Tor: always" i think.

>>d077b9de-fb4e-47b8-b66b-9d0eaa751186
> is it actually working now?
YES it works for me. i have not needed to disable "This is my site" option, it updated the data/users/content.json file automaticaly. I went to ZeroHello site, found the 08chan, clicked the three dots next to the item (mouse hover over item) and selected "Check files". One may need to confirm to increase site size a few times. Or do not wait for ZeroHello prompts and increase it via 08chan site menu (corner button moving to the left at 08chan site).

I TESTED to post under zeroid and my old 08chan ID, both worked. But when i posted under new 08chan ID, then it prevented me posting (which is correct - admin allows only zeroid.bit identities). So all works. It seem not broken my Millchan update! :-)

>>a86a0926-5940-4b96-81c2-44aae4f8f5ad
08chan is a millchan clone, millchan repo & license: https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/blob/master/LICENSE
PINning on zeronet means usually to mark the file for download and seeding. Currently such file will not be removed by the garbage collector of the zeronet if i am correct: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+garbage+collector
On this site, [Pin] should download (and distribute) board content (images, videos, music).
If you have ZN questions, use ZN board. ðŸ‘

What about "Download and help distribute all files" option. Do you have it enabled?
Did you click the [Pin] button next to the board?
Do you have updated version (millchan) and clicked to Help distribute some user files?
You may delete unwanted images by finding user who posted it and muting him, also by blacklisting bad board(?) click the board address?

>>8b4fa98f-d81f-4b35-959b-fd7248d93b43
Hi ) what is the purpose of this board? Will there be any images?

>>9b4f8963-70b8-467c-85cc-91e8c032fd5b
you are anonymous even with zeroid to my knowlege
>>946
we wil be spammed even with zeroid. we need someone to fix zeronet to prevent spam b0ts hurting sites for everyone

posts.subject: ProtonVPN
posts.body: [All ProtonVPN apps are now open source and audited](https://protonvpn.com/blog/open-source/)

posts.subject: Re: PiHole
posts.body:
>>693529ba-353b-40fc-bfa6-2dacfa51c276
i wanted to try it too, but i do not have spare pi, since PiHole is stand alone OS and can not (if i am correct) run on top of the Raspbian. So i ended up using web browser extensions to block trackers - i know it is not as good as blocking it by PiHole firewall..

>>8f9d9fd9-d624-4384-aa1e-5afbbf651c03
Hi, on my Linux i am setting the network connection to use VPN (the network connection properties has that option by defaulot or you need to install vpn support somehow into the Linux) on connect and if VPN server does not connect, neither the internet works. If you want to use Tor for the Zeronet, then you should not need to care about any killswitch, since you can set zeronet to use tor only and if tor will not be available, ZN will not connect internet. That setting is on [/Config](/Config) page.
The poster before me given a link to the Tor, Zeronet instalaltion details. Check it out..

note for readers, i think the Tor ports mentioned in the above zeronet.conf may be different on Windows/Linux.

Regarding "trackers =" variable, i am wondering whether it is good idea to "hardcode" these in config file. I would think better for ZN to discover new up to date trackers on its own? Or these trackers are mainly bootstrap ones added by zeronet maintainer? Myself i add trackers via UI: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Config

Regarding "trackers_file = ", people have to visit site 15CEFKBRHFfAP9rmL6hhLmHoXrrgmw4B5o in order for ZN to use it i think.

Regarding "*connected_limit" (Max connected peer per site (default: 8)) and "workers" (Download workers per site), why do you think it is good like this (for Raspberry)? Why not to set more workers and why to reduce number of connected peers per site?

[7 VPN services left data of millions of users exposed online](https://securityaffairs.co/wordpress/106181/data-breach/7-vpn-data-leak.html)
The impacted VPN services are UFO VPN, FAST VPN, FREE VPN, SUPER VPN, Flash VPN, Secure VPN, and Rabbit VPN.
posts.subject: 7 VPN services private data leak

posts.body:
[MuWire filesharing and communication software](https://github.com/zlatinb/muwire/) is using I2P by default for communication. I suggest it, it is small now, but needs some love (means people to use it and share their files).

Btw. when i was using bittorrent client [Tribler](https://www.tribler.org/) (it is using Tor-like anonymization too) and acted as exit node, i have got a DMCA notice of sharing copyrighted content (means i relayed someone's seeding to the leecher, who possibly was a computer of the agency hunting pirates)

> if you fail to get that config file right
in the three dots menu next to ZN logo at [ZeroHello](/) site is the Configuration option which launch the [/Config](/Config) page which should be the safe place to configure ZN. Though i agree that ZN has room fro improvement detecting misconfiguration and user friendly reporting to user.

Very good advises on how to host questionable website, thanks for sharing. Clearnet version is btw.: 
A) https://postimg.cc/McBJz8LX
B) https://weboas.is/faq/net/#collapseFiftyNine1

After today's Firefox upgrade to 94.0.1, i have seen an announcement of [Mozilla VPN](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/products/vpn/) i think that along with https://protonmail.com/ this would be my top VPN choice. If i would not be using my [own VPN server](/1LfvE91ZF18jdG3wW62Dw7NtfTZh737KPL/?Topic:1548340010_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS).
